crew/conrak.html.title: Conrak
crew/conrak.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: he/him NumRank:: 4 Rank:: Lieutenant Type:: Player Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Haplorhini, Rondero Role:: Chief of Security
Portrait:: Note:: Competitive, fierce, and looking to serve and protect after experiencing the Battle of Wolf-359. Value1:: Haplorhini are the chosen Value2:: Service before self Value3:: My crew is my clan Value4:: Danger and I are old companions
Conrak consulted Val while working on his personal energy shield project.
Conrak often feels a competitive urge to one-up Val.
Conrak saved Skklarr from an EVA situation at Wolf-359
Both Skklarr and Conrak accept violence as a necessary evil.
Conrak and Eve both have a bonsai tree hobby.
Hick and Conrak believe in the versatility of the phaser as a tool as well as a weapon.

Note:: Saved from execution after the Dominion War by Val and now piloting the Sekhmet. Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::

crew/shranval-'val'.html.title: Shranval 'Val'
crew/shranval-'val'.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: they/them NumRank:: 3 Rank:: Lt. Commander Type:: Player Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Vulcan-Andorian Role:: Executive Officer
Portrait:: Note:: Former Andorian military, now working in Starfleet to make a difference on a new frontier. Value1:: We are all connected despite being worlds apart Value2:: Good leaders get their hands dirty Value3:: Act with confidence, even if you don’t feel confident Value4:: You must walk barefoot in the dirt to really understand a world
Conrak consulted Val while working on his personal energy shield project.
Conrak often competes with Val.
Both Val and Sorran share a mutual understanding of poly relationships. [Sorran] stopped Val from firing on a threat in what turned out to be a first contact situation.
Val talks to Skklarr about his cross-cultural identity.
Val saved Relek Tovan from execution.
Grav Tholgar has respect for Val's bravado.

crew/skklarr.html.title: Skklarr
crew/skklarr.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: he/him NumRank:: 7 Rank:: Master Chief Petty Officer Type:: Player Character Status:: Enlisted Species:: Gorn Role:: Operations Manager
Portrait:: Note:: A Gorn raised by the overly cautious Kelpians, now working as an engineer on a frontier that's anything by safe. Value1:: my kingdom for some threat ganglia Value2:: give me a hyperspanner, and I can fix it Value3:: the captain may command her, but this ship is MINE Value4:: I'll use my fear to protect others
Sorran originally treating Skklarr like a curiosity.
Both Skklarr and Conrak accept violence as a necessary evil.
Conrak saved Skklarr from an EVA situation at wolf-359
Val talks to Skklarr about cross-cultural identity.
Su'Kra is Skklarr's sister.
Both Skklarr and Bov are obsessed with engineering and tinkering.

crew/sorran.html.title: Sorran
crew/sorran.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: he/him NumRank:: 4 Rank:: Lieutenant Type:: Player Character Status:: Species:: Denobulan Role:: Science Officer
Portrait:: Note:: An expert in hazardous material properties and disposal, with a contingency for every situation and a curiosity for every field of knowledge. Value1:: Optimism is Tactical Value2:: Every Discipline Has Something to Teach. Value3:: To Protect Life, I Must Understand What Threatens It. Value4:: Prepared for Anything, Expected or Not.
Constantly learning new things from Conrak, Sorran's gym partner.
Sorran once stopped Val from firing on a potential threat, in what turned out to be a first contact situation.
Shares an understanding of poly relationships with Val.
Sorran originally treated Skklarr like a curiosity.
both Sorran and Edo'erax share a concern for workplace safety.

crew/victoria-drake.html.title: Victoria Drake
crew/victoria-drake.html.description:
Info Location:: USS Sekhmet Pronouns:: she/her NumRank:: 6 Rank:: Ensign Type:: Player Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Human Role:: Engineering Specialist
Portrait:: Note:: Value1:: If I didn’t build it, I can still improve it. Value2:: There’s no such thing as an unsolvable problem—only insufficient creativity. Value3:: If it can’t be fixed, it can teach. Value4:: Starfleet thrives on ingenuity; I intend to prove it every day.

lore/the-shackleton-expanse.html.title: The Shackleton Expanse
lore/the-shackleton-expanse.html.description:
The Shackleton ExpanseFar from the heart of the Federation lies the Shackleton Expanse, a massive area of space deep within the Beta Quadrant. Informally named after the renowned ancient Earth explorer Ernest Shackleton, the Expanse has, remained largely unexplored. Few resources have been committed to exploring the Expanse. Until now, Starfleet preferred to focus on higher-priority regions closer to home. With the end of the war and several years to recover behind the Federation, exploration has become a renewed priority.We have no reliable intelligence reports to suggest that either the Klingon Empire or the Romulan Star Empire have bothered to send reconnaissance ships or probes into the Expanse. Our Klingon allies apparently have no survey data to share, and the Romulan science corps is unwilling to part with any data they may haveWhat little we do have:
Patchwork of probe telemetry
A hodgepodge of brand new colonies just now breaking ground on the nearest systems.
Long range sensor scans
Unreliable data
Stories from independent colonists and their crews who have traveled through the Expanse over the years. Surveys and personal logs from independent traders are rife with unsubstantiated reports of subspace interference, electromagnetic waveforms, and tetryonic storms.No known sentient species has claimed to be from a world within the Expanse. It's unknown why this might be.
Built in tribute to the Klingon colonists who were massacred during a Romulan sneak attack against the Narendra III outpost in 2344, the starbase also serves as a reminder of the pivotal shift in Klingon-Federation relations that assault caused.
Now Narendra Station has become the foremost outpost for Federation colonization into the Shackleton Expanse.

mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.1-ba.title: Sekhmet Log 1.1 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.1-ba.description: Stardate:: 67156 Mission:: Bacchus' Irresistible Call Note:: The Sekhmet investgated a missing science team at Bacchus-3, only to get caught in the same subspace distortion wave and became stranded. On the planet, they found the team strange entranced by massive monoliths, even willing to die to get inside.The USS Sekhmet was sent to investigate the disappearance of a Starfleet science shuttle at the Bacchus system. When the Sekhmet arrived, it was violently thrown out of warp by a massive subspace distortion wave. With warp-speed rendered impossible and subspace communications completely washed out by background subspace frequencies in the system, they managed to push a probe far enoguh outside the system to get a distress signal out.Next, an away was sent down to Bacchus-3 to investigate the source of the distortion waves. A small coalition team of Starfleet and Klingon officers seemed entranced by the giant monoliths sticking out of the surface of the planet. Soon, the scientists opened the monoliths, revealing a facility on the inside. Two of the closest scientists threw themselves into the facility, getting vaporized instantly.
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.1-ba.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 1.1 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call.md

mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.2-es.title: Sekhmet Log 1.2 - Escaping from Bacchus-3
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.2-es.description: Stardate:: 67156 Mission:: Bacchus' Irresistible Call Note:: The Sekhmet's away team ventured into the spire on Bacchus-3, and found a message from an unknown alien race. They asked the away team to find "the facility". They disabled the subspace distortion wave, and evacuated from the planet and the system, bringing wanted Klingon pirates with them.The Sekhmet's away team managed to retrain the remaining survivors on Bacchus-3 before they ran into the spire's interior. Val mind-melded with the science team's vulcan officer, and found a repeating message in his subconscious: "Find the facility." Sorran Vek found that D'Lok, a Klingon, at a brainwave resonating with the subspace distortion frequency.Conrak phasered one of the two phaser arrays guarding the entrance, which activated a security system closing the door. Conrak rushed forward and held the door open while Val disabled the second one. The away team entered the spire, leaving a small security team to guard the restrained scientists.Inside, the engineering specialist Victoria noted the amounts of power running through the spire was no enormous there were very few practical uses for it all. But it was enough power to punch wormholes through space-time. At the center of the spire, the found a control room with consoles for security, power management, subspace field generation, and more. They disabled the security system first, and then turned off the subspace field generator.An automated hologram projection of an alien introduced themselves as representing the "Displaced." The implored the group to find something called "The Facility" but didn't know where it was. It said its people were in peril and asked for the away team to go save them. It directed the away to to collect a bread-box sized sandstone prism with runes carved along the outside.The automated messenger finally urged them to leave quickly, because their ship would be in danger. The spires of Bacchus-3 was tractoring the nearest planet towards it, ripping the planet apart as it went. It was rebuilding a new Spire to replace the disabled one. A meteor shower threatened to destroy the Sekhmet and a disabled Klingon vessel. The away team and others on the surface returned to the SekhmetThe Klingon vessel had arrived to find their "compatriots", and demanded to have them returned. Val convinced the Klingons that if they allowed the Sekhmet to tractor them out of the system to safety, then the fugitives would be returned, with an implication that they would be set free.However, the commanding officer Vrenta Ewasi instead ordered the Sekhmet to rendezvous with Starfleet vessels answering a distress signal. The Klingons were arrest, and the Sekhmet praised for not only saving the survey team, but also bringing in wanted criminals.
mission-logs/missions/sekhmet-log-1.2-es.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Sekhmet/Shared/Mission Logs/Missions/Sekhmet Log 1.2 - Escaping from Bacchus-3.md

uss-sekhmet.html.title: USS Sekhmet
uss-sekhmet.html.description:
Summary Location:: The Shackleton Expanse
Portrait:: Note:: Pulled back into service to supplement Starfleet's overextended fleet, the USS Sekhmet stands on guard over Narendra station and the Shackleton Expanse beyond. The USS Sekmet is a Columbia Class cruiser stationed at Narendra Station. After the bombings on the Mars Utopia Planitia shipyards, Starfleet supplemented it's fleet by pulling retired vessels back into service with substantial refits.The Sekhmet carries a crew of a little over 100 crewman and officers. Federation Starship Columbia Class Garbage Scow Sekhmet is the Egyptian goddess of war and medicine. The USS Sekhmet is the first of it's name, and was chosen to signal it's equal potential as a protector and threat.The USS Sekhmet, has been assigned to Narendra station as an emergency response and tactical strike starship. While Sekhmet has a regular crew, the Narendra Station provides a rotating roster of commanding officers due to stretched personnel resources and the Sekhmet's irregular mission schedule.
Sekhmet Log 1.1 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call: Stardate 67156, Session: 1The Sekhmet investgated a missing science team at Bacchus-3, only to get caught in the same subspace distortion wave and became stranded. On the planet, they found the team strange entranced by massive monoliths, even willing to die to get inside.The USS Sekhmet was sent to investigate the disappearance of a Starfleet science shuttle at the Bacchus system. When the Sekhmet arrived, it was violently thrown out of warp by a massive subspace distortion wave. With warp-speed rendered impossible and subspace communications completely washed out by background subspace frequencies in the system, they managed to push a probe far enoguh outside the system to get a distress signal out.Next, an away was sent down to Bacchus-3 to investigate the source of the distortion waves. A small coalition team of Starfleet and Klingon officers seemed entranced by the giant monoliths sticking out of the surface of the planet. Soon, the scientists opened the monoliths, revealing a facility on the inside. Two of the closest scientists threw themselves into the facility, getting vaporized instantly.
Sekhmet Log 1.2 - Escaping from Bacchus-3: Stardate 67156, Session: 2The Sekhmet's away team ventured into the spire on Bacchus-3, and found a message from an unknown alien race. They asked the away team to find "the facility". They disabled the subspace distortion wave, and evacuated from the planet and the system, bringing wanted Klingon pirates with them.The Sekhmet's away team managed to retrain the remaining survivors on Bacchus-3 before they ran into the spire's interior. Val mind-melded with the science team's vulcan officer, and found a repeating message in his subconscious: "Find the facility." Sorran Vek found that D'Lok, a Klingon, at a brainwave resonating with the subspace distortion frequency.Conrak phasered one of the two phaser arrays guarding the entrance, which activated a security system closing the door. Conrak rushed forward and held the door open while Val disabled the second one. The away team entered the spire, leaving a small security team to guard the restrained scientists.Inside, the engineering specialist Victoria noted the amounts of power running through the spire was no enormous there were very few practical uses for it all. But it was enough power to punch wormholes through space-time. At the center of the spire, the found a control room with consoles for security, power management, subspace field generation, and more. They disabled the security system first, and then turned off the subspace field generator.An automated hologram projection of an alien introduced themselves as representing the "Displaced." The implored the group to find something called "The Facility" but didn't know where it was. It said its people were in peril and asked for the away team to go save them. It directed the away to to collect a bread-box sized sandstone prism with runes carved along the outside.The automated messenger finally urged them to leave quickly, because their ship would be in danger. The spires of Bacchus-3 was tractoring the nearest planet towards it, ripping the planet apart as it went. It was rebuilding a new Spire to replace the disabled one. A meteor shower threatened to destroy the Sekhmet and a disabled Klingon vessel. The away team and others on the surface returned to the SekhmetThe Klingon vessel had arrived to find their "compatriots", and demanded to have them returned. Val convinced the Klingons that if they allowed the Sekhmet to tractor them out of the system to safety, then the fugitives would be returned, with an implication that they would be set free.However, the commanding officer Vrenta Ewasi instead ordered the Sekhmet to rendezvous with Starfleet vessels answering a distress signal. The Klingons were arrest, and the Sekhmet praised for not only saving the survey team, but also bringing in wanted criminals.

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_siteName.description: The name of the vault / exported site

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
